alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 12:28PM EST until January 05 at 2:18PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. For the Neuse River...including Clayton and Smithfield..Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River Near Clayton. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Mindor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, The Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 6.2 feet and then begin rising this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage this evening to 11.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 2.2 feet and then begin rising Friday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Clayton 9.0 6.7 Mon 11 am ES 11.1 6.6 3.2 2.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1230 AM EST.
